author: rhuijben
msg: * STATUS: Nominate a fix for yet another serf problem

author: rhuijben
msg: Following up on r1154278, add a similar fallback behavior as neon has, in serf
for retrieving dirent->has_props on older servers (< Subversion 1.4).
The test behavior in neon might be a bit cleaner (test before using), but
simply checking the result doesn't cause additional requests on the very
likely case that we have a server that does support deadprop-count.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_serf/serf.c
(get_dirent_props): Add session argument and retrieve allprops when
necessary.
(svn_ra_serf__stat,
svn_ra_serf__get_dir): Update caller and perform request again if we just
learned that we are talking to a very old server which doesn't handle
deadprop-count.

author: hwright
msg: On the fs-py branch:
When handling exceptions raised in Python code, insert the python stack trace
into our own error tracing.
* subversion/libsvn_fs_py/py_util.c
(create_py_stack): New.
(load_module): Use create_py_stack() to build the appropriate error, and
fix up a couple of cleanup stuffs.
(svn_fs_py__init_python): Don't search for the exception type if the module
didn't load.
* subversion/include/svn_error_codes.h
(SVN_ERR_BAD_PYTHON): New.

author: aconway
msg: QPID-3399: Qpidd possible memory leaks
Replace vector with deque in PollableQueue.  Under load the queue can
get long, and a vector, which allocates space in a single block, is a
memory hog. A deque will give and take memory in reasonable chunks as
the queue grows and shrinks.

author: kgiusti
msg: QPID-3346: refactor queue interface to support consumer-based message selection.
